description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8tgse","text":"The DAPI-based fluorometric estimation of polyphosphate from microalgae has been widely used in field samples since the method was published by Martin P. et al., where fluorescence of DAPI-stained samples is analyzed in quartz cuvettes by spectrofluorometer. In order to minimize the photobleaching of DAPI and reduce the consumption of reagent, time and labor, we have now scaled this method to  96-well black microtiter plate. Regarding to the matrix effects in microplate, the calculation has been modified accordingly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccc75","text":"Our method permits processing nine samples by using only 250 uL of extracted sample, 500 uL of RNase, 500 uL of DNase, 1000 uL of proteinase and  \u003c2000 uL of DAPI (100 uM). A lid with black film can protect all DAPI-stained samples from photobleaching.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l4qj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6g7a5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cilh","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Martin, Patrick \u0026 Van Mooy, Benjamin","can_edit":1,"date":null,"doi":"http://doi.org/10.1128/AEM.02592-12","guid":"DD3309F0478A11EAA276BDC7396C1647","id":220,"journal":"Applied and Environmental Microbiology","title":"Fluorometric Quantification of Polyphosphate in Environmental Plankton Samples: Extraction Protocols, Matrix Effects, and Nucleic Acid Interference"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"fc0et","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6422g","text":"Total particulate phosphorus (TPP) measurement is recommended prior to the extraction of polyphosphate. The level of TPP helps to estimate the volume of extraction solution.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30qv4","text":"Different species or different sample locations (for field samples) require different numbers of extraction. A preliminary extraction efficiency test helps to obtain optimized number of extraction for extracting the most amount of polyphosphate with the least number of extraction.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfhna","text":"Extracted polyphosphate must be measured on the same day. Polyphosphate loss has been observed if the extraction is processed days after.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dv2n","text":"The polyphosphate standard aliquot can only be thawed and used once. Do not refrozen and thawed multiple times.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s24g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
